questionsData.title: Wood is the only substance that is found in the three states.
questionsData.explain_answer:
False – Wood is not the only substance that can exist in three states of matter (solid, liquid, and gas).

Wood primarily exists in a solid state in nature. However, under certain conditions, it can be transformed into gas through combustion (burning) or into liquid through complex chemical processes (such as in the production of wood-derived chemicals). However, water is a common substance that naturally exists in all three states: solid (ice), liquid (water), and gas (water vapor), making it more representative of substances that can naturally exist in these forms.

 

خطأ – الخشب ليس هو المادة الوحيدة التي توجد في الحالات الثلاث (الصلبة، السائلة، الغازية).

الخشب يوجد في الحالة الصلبة بشكل أساسي في الطبيعة. ولكن يمكن تحويله إلى غاز عند احتراقه أو إلى سائل من خلال عمليات كيميائية معقدة. ومع ذلك، فإن الماء هو المثال الأبرز لمادة توجد طبيعيًا في الحالات الثلاث: صلبة (الجليد)، سائلة (الماء)، غازية (بخار الماء)، مما يجعله أكثر تمثيلاً لهذه الفكرة.

questionsData.title: The bowl of a spoon makes images look bigger.
Windows can be made out of metal and glass.
Camels and llamas live in different places.
Suffixes are group of letters added at the end of the stem of the word.
Rescue teams are people who rescue people.
Help given to homeless people is first-aids.
questionsData.explain_answer: Help given to homeless people is tents and blankets.

questionsData.title: "Impatient" means "to be able to wait and listen quietly"
questionsData.explain_answer: "Impatient" means "can not to be able to wait and listen quietly"

questionsData.title: "Pa" means "for the year".
questionsData.explain_answer:
"Pa" => per annum =  for each year = for the year .

Example : My present salary is 15,000 per annum.

questionsData.title: A suffix always changes the meaning of the word.
Jars are big glass bottles.
questionsData.explain_answer:
Jars are generally smaller than bottles.

Jars are commonly used for canning and preserving various types of foods, such as jams, jellies, pickles, sauces, and spreads.

questionsData.title: Beach and coast have the same meaning.
The text is mainly talking about …….
questionsData.article: Travelling from one city or country to another can contribute to spread of disease. When people arrive in a new place, they may bring in germs that were not present before. The people (there 3), may have no natural protection against these new germs, so they catch the disease more easily. Because it is unfamiliar, health workers may not identify it, and may not take any measures to stop it from spreading. People with the disease may continue to have contact with others. In this way, the germs travel from person to person through the population. This was what happened, for example, when soldiers travelled back home at the end of World War 1, bringing with them the germs of the Spanish flu. (Pollution 1) of oceans can also be a factor in spreading disease. The pollution can be caused by chemicals used in farming that wash into rivers, and then into the ocean. These pollutants result in the (increased 2) growth of tiny plants called algae. They can form a thick mass in the water, and they provide an ideal habitat for Cholera, a deadly disease. Cholera germs have travelled this way from India to South America, causing an epidemic that killed thousands of people.
